title: The Movies: our modern art. The Lost world revisited
creator_credit: Spectre Pictures, Dennis R. Atkinson and W. Gyorgy
brief_description: A tribute to the Special Effects wizardry of Willis H O’Brien. A 1925 production of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s story is a classic of the silent era, and with King Kong, produced eight years later, O’Brien was proved a master of special effects. Analyses his artistic genius and contains a rare interview with O’Brien taken shortly before his death in 1962.
